website_summaries.verdict: A primer that works best when mixed into foundation. Provides skin with a smooth, glowing appearance.
pros: Works well on all skin types

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff! Just NOT as a Primer...
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why L'Oreal calls this a Primer. It doesn't really have the attributes that make a Primer a Primer. Such as a nice smoothed out canvas to apply Foundation to. It's too lightweight to function like that, plus there's only 0.68 fl Oz. What I DO use it for it works wonderfully: I mix a little in with foundation before applying it. Improves the spreadability and luminosity of foundations. Plus can help lighten a slightly too-dark foundation. And I appreciate there's NO sparkle or glitter effect thank goodness! "Lumi Light Infusing"? Yes definitely. "Primer"? Not really.
customer_reviews.author: NotSoDitzyDame

customer_reviews.title: it made my foundation blend so easily and stayed put all day
customer_reviews.text: I heard about this primer from a beauty guru and given its affordable price, i decide to give it a try. When it first tried it on the back my hand, the primer has a very illuminating finish and it felt slightly oily, so I was a little concerned when I applied it to my face this morning (I have combination skin, oily T-zone). But OMG, it made my foundation blend so easily and stayed put all day. My skin also glows really natural and wasn't overly oily at all. I love this product. I think it fits me better than even Benefit's porefessional.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great luminous finish for your face

It can be used as a primer, but I prefer to use my Smashbox primer instead and this Lumi primer after with my foundation. This is a great dupe for the MAC stobe cream, without the hefty price tag!

customer_reviews.title: Not Illuminationating Headlines!

customer_reviews.title: Favorite primer.

I started using this after the BabySkin Primer started mostly sliding off my face, and foundation just smeared around with it. I love it. It's not too greasy and seems to absorb into the skin moreso than just sitting there. It's worked well with all of my foundations though I do use FitMe the most. I do like that it isn't clear because I can see where it's going when I apply it. It does DRY translucent though.

product_meta.title: L'Oreal Paris Magic Lumi Light Infusing Primer
product_meta.description:
Enlighten your complexion with a light infusing primer. Magic Lumi Light Infusing Primer is a unique liquid light formula that blends seamlessly into skin to boost its liveliness and luminosity. Texture is smoothed and toned for a natural-looking complexion. Use with True Match Lumi and Magic Lumi highlighter for an added boost of luminosity.

BRAND STORY
By L'Oreal Paris
feature_bullets: The light infusing face primer enlightens complexion, instantly illuminates, and prolongs the wear of any makeup look
A unique light liquid formula, Magic Lumi primer blends seamlessly into skin to boost its liveliness and luminosity
Magic Lumi primer works on all skin types and tones to smooth texture, minimize the appearance of pores, and even tone for a natural-looking, flawless complexion
Wear on its own for a supple, dewy look, wear under or mix it with your foundation for an all over radiant finish, or dab it on key areas as a highlighter
For a soft, candlelit effect, dab Magic Lumi Light Infusing Primer onto freshly moisturized cheeks, forehead, nose and chin, then blend
